wipe out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to destroy, remove, or get rid of something completely
wipe out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Whole villages were wiped out by the floods.
Nothing could wipe out his bitter memories of the past.
wipe out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make you feel extremely tired
wipe out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The heat had wiped us out.
wipe out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to fall or hit an object when you are doing something
wipe out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Scott wiped out on his bike.
